title: To ensure the security of United States ports, and for other purposes.
content: Port Security Act of 2006 - Amends the Defense Production Act of 1950 to prohibit a merger, acquisition, or takeover that will result in a foreign government-owned entity leasing, operating, managing, or owning real property or facilities at a US port. Requires the President to: (1) report to Congress on the leasing, operating, managing, or owning of real property or facilities at US ports by entities that are foreign government-owned. (2) provide notice to Congress and relevant public officials of the required mandatory investigation into whether a proposed merger, acquisition, or takeover could affect US national security. And (3) provide for public comment with respect to such transactions.
